TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IAccPropServer

Docs.summary: The and all of its exposed members are part of a managed wrapper for the Component Object Model (COM) interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about <xref:Accessibility.IAccPropServer>, see the documentation for `Dynamic Properties` in the Microsoft Active Accessibility documentation in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

MemberSignature.Value: public void GetPropValue (ref byte pIDString, uint dwIDStringLen, Guid idProp, out object pvarValue, out int pfHasProp);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void GetPropValue(unsigned int8 pIDString, unsigned int32 dwIDStringLen, valuetype System.Guid idProp, object pvarValue, int32 pfHasProp) runtime managed

Docs.param: Contains a string that identifies the property being requested.
Specifies the length of the identity string specified by the pIDString parameter.
Specifies a GUID indicating the desired property.
Specifies the value of the overridden property. This parameter is valid only if pfHasProp is TRUE. The server must set this to VT_EMPTY if pfHasProp is set to FALSE.

Indicates whether the server is supplying a value for the requested property. The server should set this to TRUE if it is returning an overriding property or to FALSE if it is not returning a property (in which case it should also set pvarValue to VT_EMPTY).
Docs.summary: The and all of its exposed members are part of a managed wrapper for the Component Object Model (COM) interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about <xref:Accessibility.IAccPropServer>, see the documentation for `IAccPropServer::GetPropValue` in the Microsoft Active Accessibility documentation in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
